title: Raidou Remastered Switch 2 Preorders Are Now Available
description: Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army Launch Edition $50 for console / $44 (was $50) for PC | Releases June 19 Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Walmart Save on PC preorders One of Megami Tensei's most obscure subseries is returning with Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army on Nintendo Switch 2, Switch, PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X|S, and PC on June 19. The new game is a remaster of the action-RPG Devil Summoner: Raidou Kuzunoha vs. the Soulless Army that originally launched on PlayStation 2 back in 2006. The new version features enhanced graphics and retooled gameplay, so it should be the ideal way to experience one of the most unique Megami Tensei spin-offs. It's also one of the first games launching on the upcoming Switch 2. Preorders for Raidou Remastered's physical edition for console are available at multiple retailers, including Amazon and Walmart, for $50. PC players can save on Steam key preorders for the standard and Digital Deluxe editions at Fanatical.Preorder physical edition at Amazon -- $50Preorder for PC at Fanatical -- $44 ($50)Preorder Digital Deluxe for PC at Fanatical -- $57.19 ($65)Editor's Note: This preorder guide was updated May 1, 2025 with Switch 2 preorder information.Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army Preorder BonusRaidou Remastered Preorder BonusesAll preorders include the Raidou Glasses DLC, which unlocks the Raidou Glasses cosmetic item Raidou can equip in-game.Continue Reading at GameSpot

html:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

One of Megami Tensei's most obscure subseries is returning with Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army on Nintendo Switch 2, Switch, PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X|S, and PC on June 19. The new game is a remaster of the action-RPG Devil Summoner: Raidou Kuzunoha vs. the Soulless Army that originally launched on PlayStation 2 back in 2006. The new version features enhanced graphics and retooled gameplay, so it should be the ideal way to experience one of the most unique Megami Tensei spin-offs. It's also one of the first games launching on the upcoming Switch 2. Preorders for Raidou Remastered's physical edition for console are available at multiple retailers, including Amazon and Walmart, for $50. PC players can save on Steam key preorders for the standard and Digital Deluxe editions at Fanatical.

  • Preorder physical edition at Amazon -- $50
  • Preorder for PC at Fanatical -- $44 ($50)
  • Preorder Digital Deluxe for PC at Fanatical -- $57.19 ($65)

Editor's Note: This preorder guide was updated May 1, 2025 with Switch 2 preorder information.

Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army Preorder Bonus

All preorders include the Raidou Glasses DLC, which unlocks the Raidou Glasses cosmetic item Raidou can equip in-game.

Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army Digital Deluxe Edition

$65 for console / $57.19 (was $65) for PC | Releases June 19

Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army is also available in a Digital Deluxe Edition that includes the base game and preorder bonus DLC, plus a selection of extra content:

  • Access to the “Kuzunoha Village Trainings”
  • Access to the “Demons of the Aril Rift” battles with special in-game rewards
  • Access to the “Guest Demons Pack,” which includes popular demons from the Shin Megami Tensei series
  • Access to the “Skill Book Pack” that grants special abilities
  • Access to the “Survival Pack,” which includes helpful battle items

Raidou Remastered – The Mystery of the Soulless Army Digital Deluxe Edition preorders are available on PC and consoles. You can save roughly $7 on your Steam key preorder by purchasing the Digital Deluxe Edition from Fanatical.

Disclosure: GameSpot and Fanatical are both owned by Fandom.

While Raidou Remastered – The Mystery of the Soulless Army drops the Shin Megami Tensei and Devil Summoner nomenclature from its title, the still game takes place within the series. It follows Raidou Kuzonoha--who fans may recognize from his appearances in other MegaTen games like Shin Megami Tensei III and Soul Hackers--an apprentice occult investigator and Devil Summoner who allies with demons to solve various mysteries in 1930s Tokyo and the mysterious Dark Realm.

Unlike other games in the MegaTen series, Raidou Remastered is an action RPG featuring real-time combat where players combo attacks as Raidou and leverage the powers of over 120 recruitable demons. Strangely, the remaster retools the game to use the combat system of the original game's sequel, Devil Summoner 2: Raidou Kuzunoha vs. King Abaddon--though the sequel is not included in this remaster. Along with the new combat system, the remaster will feature revamped visuals, new voice acting, an all-new interface, expanded environments, and numerous quality-of-life changes.
